channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Blast Kills Three in Moscow Near Site of General’s Car Bombing
item.description: Two police officers died in the explosion, the authorities said. Earlier this week a car bomb killed a military commander in the same area of Russia’s...

item.title: The Year America Blew Up the Process
item.description: The 2025 revolt against process signaled the final collapse of a powerful idea that once promised to hold the country together.

item.title: Trump just declared Christmas Eve a national holiday. Here’s what’s open and closed?
item.description: It's one of two new holidays he announced.

item.title: Zelensky Opens Way to Demilitarized Zone in Eastern Ukraine to Reach Peace
item.description: The offer was the closest Mr. Zelensky has come to addressing the thorny territorial disputes in Donetsk that have repeatedly derailed peace talks.

item.title: CEOs reveal their New Year’s resolutions for 2026: From 8-day bike races and AI training, to finally cracking 7 hours of sleep a night
item.description: Beyond the boardroom, CEOs are setting goalposts for their own growth. Here’s what execs are hoping to achieve in 2026.

item.title: Expedia CEO Ariane Gorin on the fight to ensure AI doesn’t turn her brands into invisible pipes consumers never see
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: A Christmas Argument That Ended in Harmony
item.description: Standing together on behalf of those who flee oppression is a very Christmas thing to do.

item.title: China Is Shifting Its Nuclear Forces to Swifter Footing, Pentagon Says
item.description: The country’s production of nuclear warheads has slowed, but its missiles may be poised to strike back fast in case of an attack, an annual assessment...

item.title: ‘Precarious’ is Wall Street’s defining word for 2026
item.description: Labor market softness, recession fears, AI bubbles and Fed questions are all top of mind as Wall Street heads into 2026.

item.title: The AI startups founders and VCs say could be acquisition targets in 2026
item.description: Some businesses have the tools and track records that tech giants crave.

item.title: The Truce Is 2 Months Old. So Why Have Hundreds of Gazans Been Killed?

item.description: The offer was the closest Mr. Zelensky has come to addressing the thorny territorial disputes in Donetsk that have repeatedly derailed peace talks.

item.title: The Deposed Assad Henchmen Plotting to Retake Syria
